Title: Problem Definition
Header: Clearly Defined Problem Statement
Description: Problem statement should include a clear, specific, well considered, and relate to a meaningful solvable, problem. Additionally, the problem statement should highlight why the issue is relavant, and how the problem is known to exist (Facts, Stats, Magnitude).

Title: Problem Definition
Header: Current State
Description: It is crirically important that problems are substantiated, clear, and comprehensively understood, at both executive and L6 levels. It is important to have 360 perspective of what the problem is, not simply 1 persons, or a small groups perspective (regardless of how influential that individual is).

Title: Problem Definition
Header: Historical Context
Description: You can not create a best in class solution, without knowing what has come before, why those solutoins did not fully satisfy, and where the risks lie.

Title: Problem Desired End State
Header: Specific Description of Requirements, Desires and Expectations.
Description: Needs to be very clear, such that a proposed solution can be measured as to whether it meets the criteria, while all KPIs are not necessarily defined yet several primary related to needs and expectations should be defined, and considered for plausibility.

Title: Problem Desired End State
Header: How will the tool be used?
Description: Understand very specifically, at a operational level, how will the tool be used (ie, individual a will open dashboard, they will review, if A then B, if C then D, if E then F.

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: on problem statement and desired end state, conceptualize the types of solutions and models which could be developed and implemente

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: Identify types of Models and Architectures which might be relevant in solving problem and delievering fundamental components of desired end state

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: Estimate baseline development cost for each model architecture

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: Identify and define model evaluation criteria and MVP performance requirements

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: Ensure to include a technical description of why the particular model type is appropriate or not in the context of desired solution

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: If any core components of desired end state are missing from solutions, validate with Stakeholders to clarify before proceeding forward

Title: Model Conceptualization
Header: Where possible, try to retain as much flexibility and optionality as possible, explicilty noting development time required for baseline solution

Title: Data Collection
Header: Identify Data Elements which are required, desired, and available

Title: Data Collection
Header: Locate and Confirm Data Availability
Description: Ensure accountability of this action is clear, where data is not available what will be done, change approach, obtain data, engineer data?

Title: Data Collection
Header: Completed Dictionary for all data elements included

Title: Data Collection
Header: For elements which are not available, ensure individuals are assigned as Data Stewards and a delivery dates (including refresh requirements are identified)

Title: Data Collection
Header: For new data, ensure Data Validaion, Quality and refresh frequency are explicitly dicussed and ownership for each assigned

Title: Baseline Model Selection & Validation
Header: Run initial ML pipeline, review outputs, validate model, features and preliminary results before tuning and finalization

Title: Baseline Model Selection & Validation
Header: Identify which models have best performance, rationalize performance

Title: Baseline Model Selection & Validation
Header: Identify Feature Importance, and determine if model structure is appropriate or changes are appropriate

Title: Baseline Model Selection & Validation
Header: Test alternative feature structure, explore feature engineering and explore for any unknown, or unexpected results

Title: Tune Model
Header: Hyperparameter tune models which meet MVP requirements, appear to be best in class and viable for implementation
